titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York Stock Exchange Governing Committee resolutions 1973.195
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 14:20:42 +0000.

did.unittitle: The New York Stock Exchange Governing Committee resolutions
did.abstract: The New York Stock Exchange Governing Committee resolutions are housed in a single bound volume and dated April 24, 1912. The resolutions concern the retirement of Andrew Mott Cahoone from the Governing Committee.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andrew Mott Cahoone was a Brooklyn resident, stock broker, member of the New York Stock Exchange, and a member of its Governing Committee from 1870 to 1912.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New York Stock Exchange Governing Committee resolutions are housed in a single bound volume and dated April 24, 1912. The resolutions concern the retirement of Andrew Mott Cahoone from the Governing Committee.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); The New York Stock Exchange Governing Committee resolutions, 1973.195, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of D.F. Mead, date unknown.
